p: In conclusion, we believe that the suggested protocol of targeted plasmapheresis of volunteer recovered COVID 19 patients, constitutes a feasible, well- established and effective therapeutic modality for the treatment of critically ill patients with severe respiratory distress syndrome or septic shock in COVID-19- infected patients. The phase of the disease in which this treatment modality may be most beneficial is still a matter of debate (early vs intermediate-late stages of the cytokine storm reaction phase associated with acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) or other severe disease complications).
